title: Belvoir Park Forest Walking Route

images.title: Albert Bridge / Belvoir forest, Belfast (1)
images.caption: Belvoir forest, Belfast. Belvoir forest is some 185 acres of woodland, in south/south east Belfast, between the Lagan and Newtownbreda. It opened in 1961. The plans for a motorway through it seem to have been abandoned. In this view the path is quite high above the Lagan (well hidden in the valley to the right), close to the entrance from the towpath near the Red Bridge.

images.title: The Lagan in flood at Moreland's Meadow (1) by Albert Bridge, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Lagan in flood at Moreland's Meadow on the northern side of the forest.

images.title: Albert Bridge / Lagan navigation restoration (4)
images.caption: Lagan navigation restoration. A footbridge, leading from the towpath (foreground), across the disused lock, to Belvoir forest.

images.title: Albert Bridge / Lagan navigation restoration (3)
images.caption: The same lock but looking towards Edenderry and Lisburn. This one gives an idea of the overgrown nature of the disused canal. The towpath is on the right.

description: This large park in Belfast has some nice woodland trails and views of the River Lagan which runs right through the forest. It is unusual to find a working forest within a city so the area is well worth a visit. The woods have a number of waymarked trails to try with lots of woodland wildlife to look out for. There are also interesting historic sites including the 12th century Norman motte and Ice House. You can start your walk from the forest car park, off Belvoir Drive. From here you can directly pick up the trails through the woodland, meadows and along the river. To extend your walk simply follow the Ulster Way and the Lagan Towpath along the Lagan to the nearby Lagan Valley Regional Park. The Lagan Towpath will take you through the Lagan Valley to Lisburn. You're also very close to the splendid Lady Dixon Park which includes more nice footpaths taking you to the arboretum, the Azalea Walk, fountains, a walled garden and a delightful a Japanese-style garden with pretty water features.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Northern Ireland Walks page.
